newsitem.title: EGYPT: Egypt, Jordan negotiating gas pipeline.
newsitem.headline: Egypt, Jordan negotiating gas pipeline.

text.p: Egypt and Jordan have started negotiations on a pipeline to export Egyptian gas across the Sinai peninsula to Jordan, Egyptian Oil Minister Hamdi el-Banbi said in remarks published on Thursday.

The government newspaper al-Ahram quoted him as saying that one proposal was for a 270 km (160 mile) pipeline from Uyoun Moussa on the eastern bank of the Gulf of Suez to the area around the Jordanian port of Aqaba.
It would carry 200 million cubic feet of gas a day starting in 2001 or 2002, rising later to 400 million cubic feet a day.

Egyptian and Jordanian technical working groups have been negotiating to choose the best option for the route and the Egyptian-Jordanian supreme committee will discuss the project next week, the minister added. The supreme committee usually meets at prime minister level.
